intro: Epipactis latifolia var. pallens, commonly known as the broad-leaved helleborine, is a perennial orchid native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its broad, elliptical leaves and pale greenish-yellow flowers with a distinctive lip. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and is often found in association with other orchid species. It has a complex root system and produces a single spike of flowers, usually with 5–10 blooms. The species is noted for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and is considered a rare and protected plant in many regions.
